metadata.title: CVE-2020-11724 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenResty before 1.15.8.4.ngx_http_lua_subrequest.c allows HTTP request smuggling, as demonstrated bythe ngx.location.capture API.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11724` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnginx-mod-http-geoip - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
libnginx-mod-http-image-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
libnginx-mod-http-perl - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
libnginx-mod-http-xslt-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
libnginx-mod-mail - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
libnginx-mod-stream - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
libnginx-mod-stream-geoip - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
nginx - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
nginx-common - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
nginx-core - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
nginx-extras - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
nginx-full - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
nginx-light - 1.18.0-6ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.18.0-6ubuntu2').
